This may be required to drive operational functionality.

A reference to the Data Element that corresponds to the question text and answer constraints for this question.

comments.value: If a code applies to a question, that code should still be conveyed on the question, even if the same code is also referenced as a DataElement.code in the referenced data element. This extension must not be used in place of specifying the Questionnaire.group.question.concept element.

publisher.value: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG

formal.value: Distinguishes between different types of parental relationships with varying granularity to support capturing the relationship "to the degree known".

comments.value: The Profile status has the codes that are relevant to end-users/developers, while this extension has the codes used by profile developers.

description.value: The status indicates the level of maturity of the design and may be used to manage the use of the design

Delimiters are printed without framing white space. If no value component is provided, the delimiter appears as a line break.

formal.value: Delimiters are printed without framing white space. If no value component is provided, the delimiter appears as a line break.

comments.value: This really has no rationale use in FHIR.

description.value: A coded representation for a string. Could be codes for country in a country address part, codes for prefixes in a name part, etc.
A number, letter or name identifying a delivery installation. E.g., for Station A, the delivery installation qualifier would be 'A'.

formal.value: The human-readable name for the code system.

formal.value: A code specifying the type of probability distribution for the uncertainty.

description.value: Codes specifying the type of probability distribution
Indicates the type of service offered, method of delivery. For example: post office box, rural route, general delivery, etc.

formal.value: Indicates the type of service offered, method of delivery. For example: post office box, rural route, general delivery, etc.

formal.value: Description: A street address line is frequently used instead of breaking out build number, street name, street type, etc. An address generally has only a delivery address line or a street address line, but not both.

description.value: Indicates that the style extensions in this resource are essential to the interpretation of the styled text and that it cannot be rendered without the style without losing essential information.

formal.value: Indicates that the style extensions in this resource are essential to the interpretation of the styled text and that it cannot be rendered without the style without losing essential information.

comments.value: If set to true, all systems that claim to support this extension and which render elements of the resource containing this extension SHALL either render the content as required by the style extensions defined by this profile that are present in the resource or shall (if safe to do so based on their own rules), omit entirely the styled content they cannot render in accordance with the extensions.

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR Project

name.value: No more than this many characters

description.value: The maximum number of characters that must be present in the simple data type to be considered a "valid" instance.

short.value: No more than this many characters

formal.value: The maximum number of characters that must be present in the simple data type to be considered a "valid" instance.

comments.value: For base64binary, reflects the number of characters representing the encoded data, not the number of bytes of the binary data.

description.value: Human readable names for the valueset.

formal.value: Human readable names for the valueset.
This name is intended to be human readable, short and as specific as possible and to convey the purpose of the value set. It is considered to be the name of the value set.

comments.value: This need not be unique. However some use cases require uniqueness within a namespace and therefore best practice would be to make the name unique.

short.value: Which name is preferred for this language

formal.value: Flag that this Name in this Name Language is the preferred human-readable signifier in this language.

comments.value: There may be multiple human readable names in a given language, and this flag indicates which of them is preferred for the given language.

description.value: If true, indicates that the containing group or question should not be displayed to the user for data entry.

formal.value: If true, indicates that the containing group or question should not be displayed to the user for data entry.

comments.value: Some questionnaires may have questions that represent calculated values or internal "fixed" metadata. These elements need to be included with the answers, but should not be displayed to the user.

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR project

description.value: The inclusive lower bound on the range of allowed values for the data element.

formal.value: The inclusive lower bound on the range of allowed values for the data element.

comments.value: Data type specified must be the same as the data type for the data element.

description.value: Identifies the kind(s) of [[[Attachment]]] allowed to be sent in answer to the question.

formal.value: Identifies the kind(s) of [[[Attachment]]] allowed to be sent in answer to the question.

comments.value: This extension only has meaning if the question.type = Attachment.

description.value: The mime type of an attachment

comments.value: Data type specified must be the same as the data type for the data element.

description.value: This can be a unit designator, such as apartment number, suite number, or floor. There may be several unit designators in an address (e.g., "3rd floor, Appt. 342"). This can also be a designator pointing away from the location, rather than specifying a smaller location within some larger one (e.g., Dutch "t.o." means "opposite to" for house boats located across the street facing houses).

formal.value: This can be a unit designator, such as apartment number, suite number, or floor. There may be several unit designators in an address (e.g., "3rd floor, Appt. 342"). This can also be a designator pointing away from the location, rather than specifying a smaller location within some larger one (e.g., Dutch "t.o." means "opposite to" for house boats located across the street facing houses).

description.value: A geographic sub-unit delineated for demographic purposes.

formal.value: A geographic sub-unit delineated for demographic purposes.

name.value: Whether the concept has been deprecated

description.value: Set to true of the concept has been deprecated (still can be used, but soon to be withdrawn).

short.value: Whether the concept has been deprecated

formal.value: Set to true of the concept has been deprecated (still can be used, but soon to be withdrawn).

description.value: The display name for the code. I.e. ValueSet.define.concept.display (or its equivalent).

publisher.value: Health Level Seven

description.value: A concept that represents a set of ideas, abstractions, or things in the real world that can be identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behavior follow the same rules. It may be either a single or a group of associated concepts, abstractions, or things.

formal.value: A concept that represents a set of ideas, abstractions, or things in the real world that can be identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behavior follow the same rules. It may be either a single or a group of associated concepts, abstractions, or things.

comments.value: ObjectClass and Property are treated as a data model that can be mapped to like any other. This extension merely captures the ObjectClass element as a discrete code. The information conveyed here should also be conveyed in human-readable form in the mapping.map element.

description.value: A concept that represents a set of ideas, abstractions, or things in the real world that can be identified with explicit boundaries and meaning and whose properties and behavior follow the same rules. E.g. Person, Prescription, Encounter, etc.

publisher.value: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG

comments.value: For base64binary, reflects the number of characters representing the encoded data, not the number of bytes of the binary data.

formal.value: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.

comments.value: When omitted, sections are presumed to be "regular" sections.

description.value: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.

comments.value: See comments on ValueSet.define.caseSensitive. Systems should generally assume case sensitivity when dealing with expansions, and only consider case sensitivity when matching existing codes.

description.value: The base URL for the server to which questionnaire answers associated with this questionnaire should be submitted.

comments.value: Indicates that the form has been designed with an expectation that it will be submitted to the specified URI. If multiple endpoints are specified, expectation is that answers are submitted to all endpoints.

description.value: A code that identifies the questionnaire as falling into a particular group of like questionnaires. E.g. "Pediatric", "Admissions", "Research", "Demographic", "Opinion Survey", etc.

formal.value: A code that identifies the questionnaire as falling into a particular group of like questionnaires. E.g. "Pediatric", "Admissions", "Research", "Demographic", "Opinion Survey", etc.

description.value: Classifications for questionnaires. Can include such concepts as "intake form", "opinion survey", "clinical research questionnaire", "pediatric", etc.

short.value: Date(/time) of first exposure to Substance

formal.value: Record of the date and/or time of the first exposure to the Substance for this Reaction Event.

comments.value: Exposure can be more complicated by more than one exposure events leading to a reaction. Further details about the nature of the exposure can be provided in additional extensions, or as text in the Exposure Description extension.

If present, indicates that the group or question containing the extension should only be enabled (allow an answer to be present and, in most circumstances, even be visible to the user) when the specified condition is true.

formal.value: If present, indicates that the group or question containing the extension should only be enabled (allow an answer to be present and, in most circumstances, even be visible to the user) when the specified condition is true.

comments.value: Allows questionnaires to adapt based on answers to prior questions. E.g. If physical gender is specified as a male, no need to capture pregnancy history.

description.value: Where the type for a question is "Reference", indicates a type of resource that is permitted.

comments.value: This extension only has meaning if the question.type = Reference. If no allowedResource extensions are present, the presumption is that any type of resource is permitted. If multiple are present, then any of the specified types are permitted.

formal.value: Consumers of the value set and the implementations, projects or standards that the author has utilized the value set in.

comments.value: This is likely to be a ???point in time??? view and should not be considered an authoritative listing of all uses of the value set.

short.value: A consumer of or client for the value set

formal.value: This is most likely to be an organization but can be an individual. It would not be a program, that information should be recorded in the usage.use.
A descriptive name of the project or standard in which the value set is used.

description.value: A label for a particular group or question within the questionnaire.

formal.value: A label for a particular group or question within the questionnaire.

comments.value: These are generally unique within a questionnaire, though this is not guaranteed. Some questionnaires may have multiple questions with the same label with logic to control which gets exposed.

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR Project

description.value: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR
The language in which the string is expressed.

formal.value: The language in which the string is expressed.

description.value: A human language

name.value: Standard Deviation (same units as the quantity)

description.value: The primary measure of variance/uncertainty of the value (the square root of the sum of the squares of the differences between all data points and the mean).

short.value: Standard Deviation (same units as the quantity)

formal.value: The primary measure of variance/uncertainty of the value (the square root of the sum of the squares of the differences between all data points and the mean).

comments.value: standardDeviation has the same units as the quantity. It is used to normalize the data for computing the distribution function. Applications that cannot deal with probability distributions can still get an idea about the confidence level by looking at standardDeviation.

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR Project

description.value: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

short.value: The type of the organizational relationship

description.value: Identifies the value set as belonging to a particular set. For example "demographics", "lab", "clinical research", etc. Might also be used to tie a value set to particular usage projects.

formal.value: Identifies the value set as belonging to a particular set. For example "demographics", "lab", "clinical research", etc. Might also be used to tie a value set to particular usage projects.

comments.value: The categories chosen will vary widely depending on the purpose of the value set repository.

description.value: Classifications for valuesets. Can include such concepts as "demographics", "lab", "clinical research". Might also be used to tie a value set to particular usage projects
The maximum number of times the group must appear or the minimum number of answers for a question - when greater than 1 and not unlimited.

formal.value: The maximum number of times the group must appear or the minimum number of answers for a question - when greater than 1 and not unlimited.

comments.value: Only relevant if the element has repeats=true and there's a need to constrain the number of allowed repetitions.

map.value: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

publisher.value: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG

description.value: This extension is used when there are multiple observation identifiers for a single observation . The Observation.identifier is the first identifier for this observation and any additional identifiers will go here.

formal.value: This extension is used when there are multiple observation identifiers for a single observation . The Observation.identifier is the first identifier for this observation and any additional identifiers will go here.

name.value: Indicates the state of development of the value set

description.value: Workflow Status is used to represent details of the value set development process while the value set has an Activity Status of Preliminary. The development of a value set often follows a formal workflow process from initiation to completion, and this element carries the state variable for this state machine. The assumption is that when first created a value set would have a workflow state of Draft. Additional workflow states may be used.

short.value: Indicates the state of development of the value set

formal.value: Workflow Status is used to represent details of the value set development process while the value set has an Activity Status of Preliminary. The development of a value set often follows a formal workflow process from initiation to completion, and this element carries the state variable for this state machine. The assumption is that when first created a value set would have a workflow state of Draft. Additional workflow states may be used.

comments.value: The values that this element may assume include phrases that capture various stages in review and approval. In addition to the minimum of ???Draft???, these include ???Proposed???, ???Approved???, ???Ready to Publish???. There may be additional states defined by different developers. This is an optional element because the use of Activity Status ???Preliminary??? may be sufficient for some implementations.

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR Project

description.value: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

name.value: NI | OTH | NINF | PINF | UNK | ASKU | NAV | NASK | TRC | MSK | NA | QS

description.value: If the value is not a proper value, indicates the reason.

short.value: NI | OTH | NINF | PINF | UNK | ASKU | NAV | NASK | TRC | MSK | NA | QS

formal.value: If the value is not a proper value, indicates the reason.

comments.value: Considerable care must be used when using nullFlavor in this context of FHIR - more than any other concept, this is tied to the way v3 works, and FHIR is quite different. For instance, there is no notion of a "proper value" as opposed to any other value in FHIR. a NullFlavor should be understood to mean, "why information is missing", and the nulFlavors OTH, NINF, PINF, and TRC should not be used.

description.value: A collection of codes specifying why a valid value is not present

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR project

description.value: Identifies how the specified element should be rendered when displayed.

formal.value: Identifies how the specified element should be rendered when displayed.

comments.value: This extension would be equivalent to setting the HTML "style" attribute on the root element for the element containing the extension.

name.value: Comment about the use of this code in this context

description.value: A comment that explains how this code is used in this context (where the value set is expected to be used).

short.value: Comment about the use of this code in this context

formal.value: A comment that explains how this code is used in this context (where the value set is expected to be used).

comments.value: This is used in various FHIR value sets to make comments on how particular codes are used when the formal definition is a little abstract or vague, but it's not clear whether it belongs in the actual value set resource.

description.value: This is the value that should be pre-populated when rendering the questionnaire for user input.

formal.value: This is the value that should be pre-populated when rendering the questionnaire for user input.

map.value: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

display.value: This email is a "direct" email address

publisher.value: Fhir Core Team

description.value: This email address is associated with a "direct" service - e.g. http://wiki.directproject.org/Addressing+Specification.

formal.value: This email address is associated with a "direct" service - e.g. http://wiki.directproject.org/Addressing+Specification.

comments.value: This extension can only be used on contact points where the system = 'email'.

publisher.value: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG

description.value: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource. The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional period results for this observation will go here.

formal.value: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource. The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional period results for this observation will go here.

comments.value: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

publisher.value: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG

description.value: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource. The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional attachment (numeric) results for this observation will go here.

formal.value: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource. The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional attachment (numeric) results for this observation will go here.

comments.value: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

description.value: The formal URI for the code system. I.e. ValueSet.define.system (or its equivalent).

formal.value: The formal URI for the code system. I.e. ValueSet.define.system (or its equivalent).

description.value: Identifies the relative order in which concepts within the value set should be presented to a user.

formal.value: Identifies the relative order in which concepts within the value set should be presented to a user.

description.value: Any alphabetic character, fraction or other text that may appear after the numeric portion of a building number.

formal.value: Any alphabetic character, fraction or other text that may appear after the numeric portion of a building number.

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR Project

description.value: Standard Profile for CDA R2 on FHIR

short.value: Indicates an order that this document is created to fulfill

name.value: Policy or plan th eactivity was defined by

publisher.value: Health Level Seven, Inc. - EHR WG

description.value: Policy or plan the event was defined by. Typically, a single event may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

short.value: Policy or plan th eactivity was defined by

formal.value: Policy or plan the event was defined by. Typically, a single event may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

name.value: When the value set version becomes Active and is available for use

description.value: This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes active, so this value is present on Inactive value set versions as well. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Effective Date.

short.value: When the value set version becomes Active and is available for use

formal.value: This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes active, so this value is present on Inactive value set versions as well. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Effective Date.

name.value: unknown | asked | temp | notasked | masked | unsupported | astext | error

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR project

description.value: Provides a reason why the expected value or elements in the element that is extended are missing.

short.value: unknown | asked | temp | notasked | masked | unsupported | astext | error

formal.value: Provides a reason why the expected value or elements in the element that is extended are missing.

description.value: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing
XDS allows multiple institutions for an author, but the Practitioner only allows one. If there a multiple institutions in an XDS record, use this extension for the additional ones.

formal.value: XDS allows multiple institutions for an author, but the Practitioner only allows one. If there a multiple institutions in an XDS record, use this extension for the additional ones.

description.value: Information on changes made to the Value Set Definition over time, and also has a contained audit trail of all such changes.

formal.value: Information on changes made to the Value Set Definition over time, and also has a contained audit trail of all such changes.

short.value: The name of this set of history entries

formal.value: Label for a set of entries, such as a version.

comments.value: Typically, a value set will have a set of history entries for each major publication milestone.

short.value: Audit of all changes for a history entry

formal.value: A list of specific changes, who made them and when.
Date the change took place.

short.value: Version marker after the change was made

formal.value: Unique id for the specific change.
Person or device responsible for the change.
Description of exactly what was changed and how.

description.value: Represents the routing information such as a letter carrier route number. It is the identifying number of the designator (the box number or rural route number).

formal.value: Represents the routing information such as a letter carrier route number. It is the identifying number of the designator (the box number or rural route number).

description.value: A display name that describes the meaning of this code when used as part of this value set.

formal.value: A display name that describes the meaning of this code when used as part of this value set.

comments.value: This is provided for when the source code system doesn't actually provide a definition (there are many such). Providing an definition for a code should not be done where the underlying code system provides a definition.

name.value: Descriptors and key terms for search

description.value: Word or words used in an information retrieval system to indicate the content of the value set.

short.value: Descriptors and key terms for search

formal.value: Word or words used in an information retrieval system to indicate the content of the value set.

name.value: LS | AC | NB | PR | HON | BR | AD | SP | MID | CL | IN

description.value: A set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type.

short.value: LS | AC | NB | PR | HON | BR | AD | SP | MID | CL | IN

formal.value: A set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type.

comments.value: Used to indicate additional information about the name part and how it should be used.

description.value: A set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type

publisher.value: Health Level Seven

description.value: Allows expressing the value set that must be stored internally by the system (as distinct from the base value set which defines values for exchange).

formal.value: Allows expressing the value set that must be stored internally by the system (as distinct from the base value set which defines values for exchange).

description.value: For attachment answers, indicates the maximum size an attachment provided in response to a question can be.

formal.value: For attachment answers, indicates the maximum size an attachment provided in response to a question can be.

comments.value: This extension only has meaning if the question.type = Attachment.

description.value: The numeric portion of a building number.

formal.value: The numeric portion of a building number.

publisher.value: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG

description.value: Defines the level of expectation associated with a given system capability.

formal.value: Defines the level of expectation associated with a given system capability.

comments.value:
If "SHALL NOT" is desired, use the "prohibited" modifier extension.
This extension should only be used with conformance profiles documenting requirements, not those documenting actual system capabilities.

description.value: Indicates the degree of adherence to a specified behavior or capability expected in order for a system to be deemed conformant with a specification

publisher.value: HL7 FHIR project

description.value: A regular expression that defines the syntax for the data element to be considered valid.

formal.value: A regular expression that defines the syntax for the data element to be considered valid.

description.value: A sub-unit of a state or province. (49 of the United States of America use the term "county;" Louisiana uses the term "parish".).

formal.value: A sub-unit of a state or province. (49 of the United States of America use the term "county;" Louisiana uses the term "parish".).

publisher.value: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG

description.value: This extension describes the reason if a test is cancelled for specimen related reason.

formal.value: This extension describes the reason if a test is cancelled for specimen related reason.

description.value: Specimen Rejection Reasons codes for identifying why a test was not performed.

publisher.value: Fhir Core Team

description.value: Name of county.

formal.value: Name of county.

publisher.value: Health Level Seven

description.value: Expresses the linkage between the internal codes used for storage and the codes used for exchange.

formal.value: Expresses the linkage between the internal codes used for storage and the codes used for exchange.

name.value: OID assigned to the value set or code system

description.value: The OID assigned to the value set or code system by the author.

short.value: OID assigned to the value set or code system

formal.value: The OID assigned to the value set or code system by the author.

name.value: Extra text to display for question

publisher.value: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)'s Standards and Infrastructure (S&I) Structured Data Capture project

description.value: Additional text to display for the question along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.

short.value: Extra text to display for question

formal.value: Additional text to display for the question along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.
The additional text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional group text. E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.

comments.value: The type of text may provide guidance for how/when to display the information.

description.value: Categorizes the type of additional group text. E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.
The name of the party who will take receipt at the specified address, and will take on responsibility for ensuring delivery to the target recipient.

formal.value: The name of the party who will take receipt at the specified address, and will take on responsibility for ensuring delivery to the target recipient.

name.value: When the value set version should no longer be used

description.value: The date when the value set version is no longer expected to be used to create new content. This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes Inactive, so this value MUST present on all Inactive value set versions. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Expiration Date.

short.value: When the value set version should no longer be used

formal.value: The date when the value set version is no longer expected to be used to create new content. This is the first date-time when the value set version becomes Inactive, so this value MUST present on all Inactive value set versions. The start Date_time is expected to be as of 0001 UTC of the Expiration Date.

comments.value: Upon reaching the Expiration Date, the value set Activity Status should be consdiered as inactive. An Inactive value set version may no longer be used to create new content, but it may be used to evaluate content created prior to the Expiration Date.

name.value: Where did this content come from

description.value: This text is intended to act as a citation to work done elsewhere that is not part of the current stewarding process where the referenced source is in some way a basis of the current value set definition.

short.value: Where did this content come from

formal.value: This text is intended to act as a citation to work done elsewhere that is not part of the current stewarding process where the referenced source is in some way a basis of the current value set definition.

comments.value: This is not intended to be a direct link to another value set. It is only intended to support a link or textual description that indicates related material for the value set.

description.value: An expression of the original string in an alternate language.

formal.value: An expression of the original string in an alternate language.

comments.value: string-translation elements should not have string-translation extensions (i.e. all translations should be expressed as siblings, not as a translation hierarchy) to simplify processing.

name.value: A category of humans sharing history, origin or nationality

publisher.value: Fhir Core Team

description.value: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.

short.value: A category of humans sharing history, origin or nationality

formal.value: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.

description.value: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.

publisher.value: Health Level Seven

description.value: A quality common to all members of an object class. A property may be any feature that humans naturally use to distinguish one individual object from another. It is the human perception of a single quality of an object class in the real world. It is conceptual and thus has no particular associated means of representation by which the property can be communicated.

formal.value: A quality common to all members of an object class. A property may be any feature that humans naturally use to distinguish one individual object from another. It is the human perception of a single quality of an object class in the real world. It is conceptual and thus has no particular associated means of representation by which the property can be communicated.

comments.value: ObjectClass and Property are treated as a data model that can be mapped to like any other. This extension merely captures the Property element as a discrete code. The information conveyed here should also be conveyed in human-readable form in the mapping.map element.

description.value: A quality common to all members of an object class. A property may be any feature that humans naturally use to distinguish one individual object from another. It is the human perception of a single quality of an object class in the real world. E.g. name, identifier, gender, creationDate

name.value: Can suppress from display to user

publisher.value: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)'s Standards and Infrastructure (S&I) Structured Data Capture project

description.value: If set to true, it means that the system displaying the form (or the individual encoding the form for data capture) can choose to omit the question from display to the user.

short.value: Can suppress from display to user

formal.value: If set to true, it means that the system displaying the form (or the individual encoding the form for data capture) can choose to omit the question from display to the user.

comments.value: If a group or question that contains other groups or questions is marked as "optional", all of its contents are automatically also treated as optional.

publisher.value: Health Level Seven, Inc. - FHIR WG

description.value: Target for Goal.

formal.value: Target for Goal.
The parameter whose value is being tracked. E.g., body weight, blood pressure, hemoglobin A1c level.

short.value: Target value of the clinical attribute

formal.value: The target value range of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal, e.g., 150 pounds, 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or above the low value.

description.value: The base name of a roadway or artery recognized by a municipality (excluding street type and direction).

formal.value: The base name of a roadway or artery recognized by a municipality (excluding street type and direction).

publisher.value: Grahame Grieve

description.value: True if the LDL value is calculated from Chol, Trig, and HDLC.

formal.value: True if the LDL value is calculated from Chol, Trig, and HDLC.

comments.value: It's definitely better that whether the LDL was calculated or not comes from the LOINC code. But this is defined to exercise the extension machinery in the publication tooling, and to make this comment. Actually, the location is odd too - it would probably be on the root observation, but this is for testing purposes.

name.value: Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere

description.value: Refers to another code defined within the code system that is also subsumed by this code. I.e. This concept subsumes the referenced concept. Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.

short.value: Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere

formal.value: Refers to another code defined within the code system that is also subsumed by this code. I.e. This concept subsumes the referenced concept. Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.

name.value: Where the activity occurred, if relevant

publisher.value: Health Level Seven, Inc. - EHR WG

description.value: The phyiscal location of the event (e.g. Building, room, etc.).

short.value: Where the activity occurred, if relevant

formal.value: The phyiscal location of the event (e.g. Building, room, etc.).

description.value: The label to list in front of a code when presenting a list of possible values in a questionnaire-like fashion.

formal.value: The label to list in front of a code when presenting a list of possible values in a questionnaire-like fashion.

publisher.value: HL7 International - Orders and Observations WG

description.value: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource. The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional quantitative (numeric) results for this observation will go here.

formal.value: This extension is used when there are multiple result values for a single Observation Resource. The first result for this observation is the value[x] element and any additional quantitative (numeric) results for this observation will go here.

comments.value: Having a single value for each Observation Resource is preferred.

description.value: The location of the delivery installation, usually a town or city, and is only required if the area is different from the municipality. Area to which mail delivery service is provided from any postal facility or service such as an individual letter carrier, rural route, or postal route.

formal.value: The location of the delivery installation, usually a town or city, and is only required if the area is different from the municipality. Area to which mail delivery service is provided from any postal facility or service such as an individual letter carrier, rural route, or postal route.

description.value: The reason that the activity was taking place.

formal.value: The reason that the activity was taking place.

description.value: Indicates the why the event occurred

publisher.value: Fhir Core Team

description.value: A code classifying a person's professed religion.

formal.value: A code classifying a person's professed religion.

description.value: A code classifying a person's professed religion
